rcomplex 0.1.0
  • Reference

Apply CLR transformation to a correlation matrix

Source: R/RcppExports.R
apply_clr_to_cor_cpp.Rd

Normalizes a correlation matrix using the Context Likelihood Ratio (CLR) transformation (Faith et al. 2007). Computes row z-scores, clamps negatives to zero, and combines row and column z-scores.

apply_clr_to_cor_cpp(cor_matrix, n_cores = 1L)

Arguments

cor_matrix

Symmetric correlation matrix (n x n)

n_cores

Number of OpenMP threads (default: 1)

Value

CLR-transformed matrix (n x n), symmetric, non-negative

Details

The CLR transformation:


z_row(i,j) = (cor(i,j) - mean(row_i)) / sd(row_i)
z_col(i,j) = (cor(i,j) - mean(col_j)) / sd(col_j)
CLR(i,j) = sqrt(max(0, z_row)^2 + max(0, z_col)^2)

This matches the original RComPlEx Rmd CLR implementation which uses R's scale() function (column-wise z-scoring on the symmetric matrix, equivalent to row-wise z-scoring due to symmetry).
